intro: Pentaschistis angulata, commonly known as the angular pentaschistis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a distinctive angular appearance, contributing to its common name.
